str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: Properly, to distinguish, i.e. Decide; by implication, to try, condemn, punish.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: From stauros; to impale on the cross; figuratively, to extinguish passion or selfishness.
